result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean William Flynn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sean William Flynn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sean William Flynn was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1, 3 and 4.
Court notes 4 days credit if revoked.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF175.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF175.

-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Unpaid costs to be converted into a civil judgment.
DNA surcharge.

Huber granted for work.
Credit for good time.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Sean William Flynn appeared from jail. Case called at 2:08 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a PTC but there is a resolution. ADA Minser recites the recommendations.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 2 Poss. of THC 2nd Offense in 15CF175. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CF175. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 1, 3 and 4 in 15CF175. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to appeal. 

Crt orders:

-    S/W 18 months probation. 4 days jail credit if probation is revoked. 

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This       prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-  Court costs and DNA Surcharge

-  AODA and follow through with recommendations

-  DNA Sample

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
